Meaning: the quality of dealing with ideas rather than events
Sample: Our mistake lies in abstraction of the one from the other, which, as always, ends in confusion of the one with the other.

Meaning: [adj] feeling or showing caution about possible dangers or problems
Sample: dogs which have been mistreated often remain very wary of strangers

Meaning: [v with obj] prevent (someone) from accomplishing something
Sample: he never did anything to thwart his father

Meaning: [n] a blunt-ended surgical instrument used for exploring a wound or part of the body; a thorough investigation into a crime or other matter; [v] physically explore or examine (something) with the hands or an instrument: researchers probing the digestive glands of mollusks.
Sample: none available

Meaning: [adj] affected by or deriving from widly uncontrolled emotion
Sample: Janet became hysterical and began screeaming

Meaning: [adj] having or showing excessive or offensive sexual desire
Sample: she ignored his lecherous gaze

Meaning: a thing that causes disgust or loathing
Sample: In the words of IS, which claimed responsibility, their target was the capital of abomination and perversion

Meaning: [adj] wishing to do one's work or duty well and thoroughly; relating to a person's conscience
Sample: The constable's feelings were hurt because he was a conscientious man

Meaning: the use of humour, irony, exaggeration, or ridicule to expose and criticize people's stupidity or vices, particularly in the context of contemporary politics and other topical issues
Sample: Charlie Hobbes (magazine from France) is a satricial novel

Meaning: having or characterized by peculiar or unexpected traits or aspects
Sample: None of us have a perfect memory, because it's too quirky, complicated and unreliable

Meaning: [adj] intended to prevent disease; [n] a medicine or course of action to prevent disease; a condom
Sample: prophylactic measures

Meaning: [n] the state of being annoyed, frustrated, or worried
Sample: Jenna bit her lip in vexation

Meaning: [n] meat from a deer
Sample: None

Meaning: [n] a kind of clay used as a building material
Sample: None

Meaning: [n] a neurological disorder marked by sudden recurrent episodes of sensory disturbance, loss of consciousness, or convulsions, associated with abnormal electrical activity in the brain
Sample: None

Meaning: a great victory or achievement; a highly successful example of something
Sample: a garden built to celebrate Napoleon's many triumphs

Meaning: [adj] not quite right; inappropriate or out of place; [adv] wrongly or inappropriately
Sample: there was something amiss about his calculations; the prime minister may have constructed his cabinet a little amiss

Meaning: [n] a homeless person or migrant worker; a tramp
Sample: The guy in Into the wild said he was a hobo

Meaning: [adj] large or heavy and therefore difficult to carry or use; slow or complicated and therefore inefficient
Sample: cumbersome diving suits; organizations with cumbersome hierarchical structures

Meaning: [adj] full of energy, excitement, and cheerfulness; characterized by a vigorously imaginative artisitc style
Sample: a noisy bunch of excuberant youngsters; exuberant, over-the-top sculptures; Adam drove exuberantly from farm to farm, picked up dirt and crumbled it in his fingers, talked and planned and dreamed

Meaning: [n] something that improperly changes something good; sexual behavior that people think is not normal or natural
Sample: all great evil is the perversion of a good

Meaning: [adj] pitifully sad and abandoned or lonely; (of an aim or endeavour) unlikely to succeed or be fulfilled
Sample: forlorn figures at bus stops; But that is a forlorn hope

Meaning: [v with obj] make (something) more attractive by the addition of decorative details or features; make (a statement or story) more interesting by adding extra details
Sample: blue silk embellished with golden embroidery; I may have embellished my characters in CSI: Regression Analysis but not the kind of significant questions they could examine

Meaning: [adj] relating to a system of government that is centralised and dictorial and requires complete subservience to the state
Sample: None

Meaning: [adj] (especially of clothing or a colour) not flattering; (of behaviour) not fitting or appropriate; unseemly
Sample: a stout lady in an unbecoming striped sundress

Meaning: [adj] spending money or using resources freely and recklessly; wastefully extravagant; having or giving something on a lavish scale
Sample: prodigal habits die hard; We do not mean the pleasures of the prodigal or the pleasures of sensuality

Meaning: [n] a natural liking for and understanding of someone or something
Sample: he had a special affinity with horses

Meaning: [v with obj] make (someone) unable to think or feel properly
Sample: It's only ten dollars, you'll think, sstupefied that you're having such conversations

Meaning: [v with obj] express to (someone) one's disapproval of or disappointment in their actions
Sample: her friends reproached her for not thinking enough about her family

Meaning: [adj] showing great care and perseverance
Sample: She cried trying assiduously to give a stern expressions to her face, into which he was gazing greddily

Meaning: [n] betrayal of trust; the quality of being deceptive
Sample: Many died because of his treachery

Meaning: [n] a thing that discourages or is intended to discourage someone from doing something
Sample: Cameras are a major deterrent to crime

Meaning: [v with obj] unable to breathe properly; suffocate; restrain (a reaction) or stop oneself acting on (an emotion)
Sample: those in the streets stiffled by the fumes

Meaning: [v] beg someone earnestly or desperately to do something
Sample: he implored her to change her mind

Meaning: [v with obj] persuade (someone) to do something by sustained coaxing or flattery
Sample: he hoped to cajole her into selling him her house

Meaning: difficult to find, catch, or achieve; difficult to remember
Sample: success will become ever more elusive.
